name: places/ChIJo2h5Rhr2wokRlzE-jFhukus
formattedAddress: 55 W 110th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 55 W 110th St, New York, NY 10026-4302, USA

originalText.text:
I was asked by my beautiful daughter "Papi, why are the People üò¥ on the street?"
I tend to explain things to her, as I would like them to be explained to me.
I couldn't and changed the subject... That day I reflected on her question...
I had to endure my path here to a shelter. And in NYC. I mouthwashed my mind on this 1st Class ‚úàÔ∏è Missing into, wait... for... it...
The underpaid, The displaced, volume 1
Getting a room takes the following.
Need a place to stay?
Ny state id or any form of identification
Want to be frowned on from regular college drop outs?
Two workers in the intake made some very inappropriate comments about a woman getting a room, the woman was crying because she just wanted to eat. üò¢
I included as many photos for the public to see that the People here are New Yorkers as well. I meet an electrician, two Bike Messagers, one Construction Worker, and
A Supermarket Delivery service Driver.
I spoke and interacted with as many people and I ordered The abovementioned Woman a Big Mac with fries üçü üôÉ.
In any situation there are solutions and beautiful people that ‚ù§ you.
I didn't come here to because I needed to find an answer for my daughter. Lol nope.
I had to come into the shelter.
Now, I understand when a young man named Timmy. "I've been waiting for a room for a whole day! I rather sleep on the D line."
D line is the D Train. He would rather sleep on a NYC train but he can't because the trains are shut down for cleaning & maintenance all in the city at the time I'm flexing, this here review.
So, click your heels üë† 3 times and count your blessings while your reading this.
Love, Family & New Yorkers

originalText.text:
Being homeless is TUFF. Putting aside the difficulties that inherently come with being homeless, this organization (BRC) runs this shelter very well.
I was transferred here from another shelter and the difference is night and day.
I feel safe here. The facilities are cleaned regularly, and the staff are genuinely helpful.
My assigned case manager regularly communicates with me and I have a plan for housing. I couldn‚Äôt ask for more.

text.text:
Being homeless is TUFF. Putting aside the difficulties that inherently come with being homeless, this organization (BRC) runs this shelter very well.
I was transferred here from another shelter and the difference is night and day.
I feel safe here. The facilities are cleaned regularly, and the staff are genuinely helpful.
My assigned case manager regularly communicates with me and I have a plan for housing. I couldn‚Äôt ask for more.

originalText.text: This is my first time actually becoming homeless and I can say I dislike it to the fullest. I wish shelter systems in New York was so much better. It looks like a jail cell in here. Feel like I‚Äôm going crazy in this room. It‚Äôs cold and some of the workers are rude. The security is very nice. The people give out food are rude in my opinion and they should tell people to sign the sheet not bang and knock at the door so loud in the night. I wish I can go back home.

text.text: This is my first time actually becoming homeless and I can say I dislike it to the fullest. I wish shelter systems in New York was so much better. It looks like a jail cell in here. Feel like I‚Äôm going crazy in this room. It‚Äôs cold and some of the workers are rude. The security is very nice. The people give out food are rude in my opinion and they should tell people to sign the sheet not bang and knock at the door so loud in the night. I wish I can go back home.

originalText.text: So this place first off let's clear up something this is not a shelter but kinda a shelter at the sametime what this place really is. Is quarantine center for shelter. What that is when you go into a  shelter before they can start on any process they have to see you don't have Covid-19. so at your original shelter they would do the covid test when done they will send you to a off site quarantine shelter where you will stay two to three days waiting on your results once cleared then you'll be able to head back to your original shelter where they can start the process. Ok now that out of the way let more about this place first off the staff amazing super friendly super nice and very helpful now that's the best part here's the downside for this to be a quarantine shelter station they don't provide you with anything to protect yourself they don't give you soap to wash your hands they don't even give you sheets for the bed they don't even give you toilet paper and when you ask all they say is we're low on stock mind you this is a homeless shelter so most people that come here don't have money so a lot of people will walk around smelling and unsanitized the waiting area or the intake area doesn't even follow the social destination law they crowd everybody together in a small area and the only hand sanitizers on the main floor near the workers the only upside is they make sure that everybody wears a mask and they give masses to people that don't have. To me that's the only downside to I see to this place cleanliness it's very clean they have a person that cleans the hallways the rooms almost every two to three hours so that's good the secondary good part of this it's located by Central Park so most rooms you have a view of the park.

originalText.text: The staff abuse there powers and don't hold each other accountable they turn a blind eye to other coworkers and blame clients for mistreatment being done and transfer anyone who speaks against there corrupt behaviors
